head.supplied: Royal Herbarium Kew ¶ April 22nd 1889, ¶ To Baron von Mueller, ¶ ¶ Enclosed is a second consignment of drawings of Australian fungi, ¶ drawn from Australian specimens with one exception. I thought i...

div.p: RB MSS M31, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: MS annotation by M: 'Answ 16/6/89'. Letter not found. Royal Herbarium Kew

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Enclosed is a second consignment of drawings of Australian fungi,
MS is filed with a bundle of letters to M about the publication of M. C. Cooke's Handbook of Australian fungi (1892). The letters are inside a folded sheet annotated by M: 'Drawings of Fungs by G. Massee 1889.' No drawings found. See also M. Cooke to M, 1 September 1889, F. Bailey to M, 17 October 1889, G. Massee to M, 7 May 1888 (in this edition as 88-05-07b), and G. Massee to M, 12 August 1889. drawn from Australian specimens with one exception. I thought it would be best to draw all the Australian species belonging to a single family, & have done so in the present instance with the
Myxogasteres. Perhaps you will say if you approve of this plan & I will then next do all the
Discomycetes
. I should be glad to prepare Monographs of the various Australian families at a very reasonable price & send you the manuscript for publication in some of your scientific journals.
I quite approve of your suggestion as to the method of paying for the drawings.
Post office order should be made for the post office, Kew, Surrey.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
